Field.Name: first-name
Field.Title: the member's first name

Field.Name: last-name
Field.Title: the member's last name

Field.Name: headline
Field.Title: the member's headline (often "Job Title at Company")

Field.Name: site-standard-profile-request/url
Field.Title: the URL to the member's authenticated profile on LinkedIn (requires a login to be viewed, unlike public profiles)

Field.Name: id
Field.Title: a unique identifier token for this member

Field.Name: maiden-name
Field.Title: the member's maiden name
Field.Remark: This field might be omitted from some results or return a value of private, depending on the member's privacy settings

Field.Name: formatted-name
Field.Title: the member's name formatted based on language
Field.Remark: This field might be omitted from some results or return a value of private, depending on the member's privacy settings

Field.Name: phonetic-first-name
Field.Title: the member's first name spelled phonetically
Field.Remark: This field might be omitted from some results depending on the member's privacy settings

Field.Name: phonetic-last-name
Field.Title: the member's last name spelled phonetically
Field.Remark: This field might be omitted from some results depending on the member's privacy settings

Field.Name: formatted-phonetic-name
Field.Title: the member's name spelled phonetically and formatted based on language
Field.Remark: This field might be omitted from some results or return a value of private, depending on the member's privacy settings

Field.Name: headline
Field.Title: the member's headline (often "Job Title at Company")

Field.Name: location:(name)
Field.Title: Generic name of the location of the LinkedIn member, (ex: "San Francisco Bay Area")

Field.Name: location:(country:(code))
Field.Title: country code for the LinkedIn member
Field.Remark: Lower case values as defined by ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 standard.

Field.Name: industry
Field.Title: the industry the LinkedIn member has indicated their profile belongs to (Industry Codes)

Field.Name: relation-to-viewer:(distance)
Field.Title: the degree distance of the fetched profile from the member who fetched the profile

Field.Name: relation-to-viewer:(related-connections)
Field.Title: Contains brief connection/person objects indicating the connecting first degree members
Field.Remark: Not available in /people/{id}/connections. For each connection, id, first-name, and last-name is returned by default. You can fetch distance using field selectors, for e.g. relation-to-viewer:(related-connections:(id,first-name,last-name,distance))

Field.Name: relation-to-viewer:(connections)
Field.Title: Deprecated: a total attribute will denote the number of connections that link the fetching member to the fetched. Contains brief connection/person objects indicating the connecting first degree members
Field.Remark: Deprecated. Use the related-connections field instead. It gives the same information but splits out the count into the num-related-connections field so you can get each separately instead of having to get them together.

Field.Name: current-status
Field.Title: the member's current status, if set
Field.Remark: Use current-share instead. Returns as empty if not in network. Capped at 140 characters.

Field.Name: current-status-timestamp
Field.Title: the timestamp, in milliseconds, when the member's status was last set
Field.Remark: Returns as empty if not in network

Field.Name: current-share
Field.Title: the member's current share, if set
Field.Remark: Overloaded to also return "current-status" (if there is no URL shared). (Status and share are the same.)

Field.Name: num-connections
Field.Title: the # of connections the member has
Field.Remark: Available in some places, such as /people/~/connections, when connections is not. More efficient than checking the total attribute of connections even when connections is available.

Field.Name: num-connections-capped
Field.Title: true if the value of num-connections has been capped at 500. false otherwise.
Field.Remark: Allows you to distinguish whether num-connections = 500 because the member has exactly 500 connections or actually 500+ because we're hiding the true value.

Field.Name: summary
Field.Title: A long-form text area where the member describes their professional profile

Field.Name: specialties
Field.Title: A short-form text area where the member enumerates their specialties

Field.Name: positions
Field.Title: A collection of positions a member has had, the total indicated by a total attribute
Field.Remark: See Positions Fields below. Only current positions are available for people other than the authenticated member.

Field.Name: picture-url
Field.Title: A URL to the profile picture, if the member has associated one with their profile and it is visible to the requestor

Field.Name: site-standard-profile-request
Field.Title: The URL to the member's authenticated profile on LinkedIn (requires a login to be viewed, unlike public profiles)

Field.Name: api-standard-profile-request:(url)
Field.Title: A URL representing the resource you would request for programmatic access to the member's profile

Field.Name: api-standard-profile-request:(headers)
Field.Title: A collection of fields that can be re-used as HTTP headers to request an out of network profile programmatically
Field.Remark: Use the name returned as the name of an HTTP header with the value returned as it's value

Field.Name: public-profile-url
Field.Title: A URL to the member's public profile, if enabled
Field.Remark: This field is only available when requested using a field selector in a profile or connections call.
